Description: TapStack.yml — Dual-mode deployment (AWS + LocalStack). AWS mode: Aurora MySQL cluster across 3 AZs with failover, reader autoscaling, alarms, and optional DAS. LocalStack mode: Single MySQL DBInstance (Aurora/DAS/autoscaling/alarms disabled automatically).

Notes: Pure YAML (no anchors/aliases; no flow-style maps/sequences)
VPC, subnets, SGs created in-stack (no external params)

Notes.Best-practice: secrets come from Secrets Manager via dynamic references (no secret params)

DeploymentTarget.Description: Set to 'aws' for real AWS. Set to 'localstack' to disable AWS-only features and use a single MySQL DBInstance.

EnvironmentSuffix.Description: Suffix added to all resource names to avoid collisions.
EnvironmentSuffix.ConstraintDescription: Must be 3–20 characters of lowercase letters, digits, and dashes.

DBInstanceClass.Description: Instance class for Aurora instances (AWS mode).

LocalDbInstanceClass.Description: Instance class for MySQL instance (LocalStack mode).

DBEngineVersion.Description: (Optional) Aurora MySQL 8.0 engine version (aurora-mysql 3.x) for AWS mode. Leave blank to use default.

LocalMySqlEngineVersion.Description: MySQL engine version for LocalStack mode.

MonitoringIntervalSeconds.Description: Enhanced Monitoring interval in seconds (AWS mode only).

PerformanceInsightsEnabled.Description: Enable Performance Insights on instances (AWS mode only).

PerformanceInsightsRetention.Description: Performance Insights retention in days (AWS mode only).

BackupRetentionDays.Description: Automated backup retention in days (AWS mode only).

PreferredBackupWindowUTC.Description: Preferred backup window in UTC (AWS mode only).

KmsKeyId.Description: Optional KMS Key ARN for Aurora storage encryption (AWS mode only).

SNSNotificationEmail.Description: Optional email to subscribe for alarms/notifications (AWS mode only).

ActivityStreamEnabled.Description: Enable Database Activity Streams (AWS mode only; auto-disabled in LocalStack mode).

ActivityStreamMode.Description: DAS mode. 'auto' tries sync then falls back to async if region doesn’t support sync (AWS mode only).

GroupDescription.Fn::Sub: App tier SG (${EnvironmentSuffix}) allowed to reach DB
DB SG - restrict to app tier only - ${EnvironmentSuffix}

Description.Fn::Sub: Cluster parameter group with binary logging enabled - ${EnvironmentSuffix}
Master password for LocalStack MySQL instance ${EnvironmentSuffix}

Properties.AlarmDescription: Alarm when Aurora replica lag (max across readers) exceeds 1 second.

Description.Fn::Sub: KMS CMK for Aurora Database Activity Streams - ${EnvironmentSuffix}

import boto3, json, logging, time, urllib.request, botocore
logger = logging.getLogger()
logger.setLevel(logging.INFO)

def _respond(url, status, req, data, phys_id, reason=None):
  short_reason = (reason[:512] + '…') if reason and len(reason) > 512 else (reason or "See CloudWatch logs for details.")
  body = {
    "Status": status,
    "Reason": short_reason,
    "PhysicalResourceId": phys_id or "RDSActivityStreamCR",
    "StackId": req["StackId"],
    "RequestId": req["RequestId"],
    "LogicalResourceId": req["LogicalResourceId"],
    "Data": data
  }
  s = json.dumps(body)
  rq = urllib.request.Request(url, data=s.encode("utf-8"), method="PUT",
                              headers={"content-type": "", "content-length": str(len(s))})
  with urllib.request.urlopen(rq) as resp:
    logger.info("CFN callback status: %s", resp.status)

def wait_cluster_ready(rds, cluster_id, timeout=900):
  start = time.time()
  while time.time() - start < timeout:
    desc = rds.describe_db_clusters(DBClusterIdentifier=cluster_id)["DBClusters"][0]
    status = desc.get("Status", "")
    as_status = desc.get("ActivityStreamStatus", "stopped")
    logger.info("Cluster %s status=%s, activityStream=%s", cluster_id, status, as_status)
    if status == "available" and as_status not in ("starting", "stopping"):
      return desc
    time.sleep(10)
  raise TimeoutError(f"DB cluster {cluster_id} not ready in {timeout}s")

def wait_kms_ready(kms, key_arn, timeout=300):
  start = time.time()
  last_err = None
  while time.time() - start < timeout:
    try:
      meta = kms.describe_key(KeyId=key_arn)["KeyMetadata"]
      state = meta.get("KeyState")
      usage = meta.get("KeyUsage")
      logger.info("KMS %s state=%s usage=%s", key_arn, state, usage)
      if state == "Enabled" and usage == "ENCRYPT_DECRYPT" and meta.get("DeletionDate") is None:
        return True
    except Exception as e:
      last_err = e
      logger.info("KMS not ready yet: %s", e)
    time.sleep(5)
  raise TimeoutError(f"KMS key not ready in {timeout}s: {last_err}")

def start_with_required_kms(rds, cluster_arn, desired_mode, kms_key):
  args = {
    "ResourceArn": cluster_arn,
    "Mode": desired_mode,
    "KmsKeyId": kms_key,
    "ApplyImmediately": True
  }
  rds.start_activity_stream(**args)

def handler(event, context):
  logger.info("Event: %s", json.dumps(event))
  req_type = event["RequestType"]
  props = event["ResourceProperties"]
  cluster_arn = props["ClusterArn"]
  cluster_id = props.get("ClusterIdentifier")
  mode_param = str(props.get("Mode", "auto")).lower()
  kms_key = props.get("KmsKeyId") or None

  rds = boto3.client("rds")
  kms = boto3.client("kms")
  phys_id = f"{cluster_arn}/activity-stream"

  try:
    if req_type in ("Create", "Update"):
      wait_kms_ready(kms, kms_key)
      desc = wait_cluster_ready(rds, cluster_id) if cluster_id else {}
      if desc.get("ActivityStreamStatus") == "started":
        _respond(event["ResponseURL"], "SUCCESS", event,
                {"ActivityStream": "ALREADY_STARTED",
                 "Mode": desc.get("ActivityStreamMode", ""),
                 "KinesisStreamName": desc.get("ActivityStreamKinesisStreamName", "")},
                phys_id, reason="Already enabled")
        return

      desired_mode = "sync" if mode_param in ("sync","auto") else "async"

      try:
        start_with_required_kms(rds, cluster_arn, desired_mode, kms_key)
      except botocore.exceptions.ClientError as e:
        msg = str(e)
        low = msg.lower()

        # Safety: if some environment doesn't support the API, do not brick the stack.
        if ("not yet been emulated" in low) or ("not available in your current license plan" in low):
          _respond(event["ResponseURL"], "SUCCESS", event,
                  {"ActivityStream": "SKIPPED_UNSUPPORTED",
                   "Reason": msg[:300]},
                  phys_id, reason="Activity Streams not supported in this environment")
          return

        if "not supported in this region" in low and desired_mode == "sync":
          start_with_required_kms(rds, cluster_arn, "async", kms_key)
          desired_mode = "async"
        else:
          raise

      time.sleep(10)
      desc2 = rds.describe_db_clusters(DBClusterIdentifier=cluster_id)["DBClusters"][0] if cluster_id else {}
      _respond(event["ResponseURL"], "SUCCESS", event,
              {"ActivityStream": "STARTED",
               "Mode": desc2.get("ActivityStreamMode", desired_mode),
               "KinesisStreamName": desc2.get("ActivityStreamKinesisStreamName", "")},
              phys_id, reason="Enabled")

    elif req_type == "Delete":
      try:
        desc = wait_cluster_ready(rds, cluster_id, timeout=300) if cluster_id else {}
        if desc.get("ActivityStreamStatus") == "started":
          rds.stop_activity_stream(ResourceArn=cluster_arn, ApplyImmediately=True)
      except Exception as e:
        logger.warning("StopActivityStream warning: %s", e)
      _respond(event["ResponseURL"], "SUCCESS", event,
              {"ActivityStream": "STOPPED_OR_NOT_ENABLED"}, phys_id, reason="Deleted")

  except Exception as e:
    logger.exception("DAS operation failed")
    _respond(event["ResponseURL"], "FAILED", event, {"Error": str(e)}, phys_id, reason=str(e))

ClusterEndpoint.Description: Writer endpoint of the Aurora cluster.

ReaderEndpoint.Description: Reader endpoint of the Aurora cluster.

LocalDbEndpoint.Description: Endpoint address of the LocalStack MySQL DB instance.

LocalDbPort.Description: Endpoint port of the LocalStack MySQL DB instance.

KinesisStreamArn.Description: ARN of the Kinesis stream receiving Database Activity Streams.

AppTierSecurityGroupId.Description: Security Group ID applications should use to reach the DB (3306).
